response.answer_text: Karnataka SSLC exam begins today for over 8.5 lakh students. BENGALURU: Allaying fears and defying calls to defer them, Karnataka is all set to conduct the Covid-hit rescheduled Secondary School Leaving Certificate (SSLC) board exams for class 10 students throughout the southern state from Thursday, an official stated on Wednesday. “Elaborate arrangements have been made to hold the SSLC exams from Thursday to July 4 for 8.5 lakh students in 3,179 centres across the state as per the lockdown guidelines to ensure the safety and welfare of the wards,” Karnataka Secondary Education Examination Board Director V. Sumangala advised IANS right here. Of the 8.5 lakh students registered to seem for the exams, 4,48,560 are boys and three,99,642 are ladies. Of the whole centres, 2,879 are predominant and 300 in block, set as much as accommodate students spilling over from different centres to make sure social distancing. Though the three-hour exam will start every day at 10.30 a.m., the students have been advised to report at their respective centres by 9 a.m. or 90 minutes earlier for thermal screening, carrying masks and washing fingers with sanitizer earlier than getting into the centre, stated Sumangala.
